snippet: Some investors and nonprofits are finding mutual interest through “social impact bonds,” which support social programs with an eye toward a profit.
abstract: Giving section focuses on ways people donate their money, time and resources; notes how some investors and nonprofits are finding mutual interest through so-called social impact bonds, which support social programs with an eye toward profit; Goldman Sachs is paying upfront costs on new program for adolescents on New York City's Rikers Island aimed at building personal responsibility and life skills, with the goal that fewer of them will re-offend.
lead_paragraph: Some investors and nonprofits are finding mutual interest through “social impact bonds,” which support social programs with an eye toward a profit.

headline.seo: Investors Profit by Giving Through Social Impact Bonds
headline.main: Getting Back More Than a Warm Feeling
headline.print_headline: Getting Back More Than a Warm Feeling
